javax.swing
Class TreeTableExample2.Reloader

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.TreeTableExample2.Reloader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.TreeExpansionListener
Enclosing class:
TreeTableExample2
 class TreeTableExample2.Reloader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.TreeExpansionListener

Reloader is the ActionListener used in the Timer. In response to the timer updating it will reset the reloadRow/reloadPath and generate the necessary event so that the display will update. It also implements the TreeExpansionListener so that if the tree is altered while loading the reloadRow is updated accordingly.

generateChangeEvent

protected void generateChangeEvent(int row)
Generates and update event for the specified row. FileSystemModel2 could do this, but it would not know when the row has changed as a result of expanding/collapsing nodes in the tree.
